Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council (Par. Seat) -- Change Parish Seat - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition

Summary:  Change the Parish seat of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana, from Pointe-a-la-Hache to Belle Chasse (Vicinity of 251 F Edward Hebert Blvd.).
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish seat of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana, be changed from Pointe-a-la-Hache to Belle Chasse (Vicinity of 251 F Edward Hebert Blvd.)?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council (HRC) -- Amend HRC - PC
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Home Rule Charter Amendment)

Summary:  Providing for the revision and replacement of the existing Home Rule Charter for Plaquemines Parish, Louisiana.
Race.FullText: Shall the existing Home Rule Charter for Local Self-Government for Plaquemines Parish, Louisiana approved at a public referendum held in said Parish, be revised and replaced by a Home Rule Charter for Local Self-Government in accordance with Article VI, Section 4 and 5 of the Constitution of Louisiana and other applicable law, as prepared and submitted by the duly constituted Charter Commission to the Council Secretary and shall such Charter for the Plaquemines Parish, Louisiana be adopted?

Race.SpecificTitle: PW PC (Dis.Vet.Homestead) -- Disabled Vet. Homestead Exemp.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Disabled Veterans Homestead Exemption)

Summary:  Authorizing an additional homestead exemption in the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana, for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended.
Race.FullText: Shall an additional homestead exemption (in addition to the homestead exemption authorized under the provisions of Article VII, Section 20 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, as amended (the "Louisiana Constitution"), which applies to the first $7,500 of the assessed valuation of property), be authorized on the next $7,500 of assessed valuation of property receiving the homestead exemption, with respect to property owned and occupied by a veteran with a service-connected disability rating of 100% by the United States Department of Veteran Affairs, and their surviving spouse, on property located in the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana, in accordance with and subject to the provisions of Article VII, Section 21(K) of the Louisiana Constitution, provided that this additional homestead exemption for certain disabled veterans and their surviving spouses shall extend and apply to property in the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana only after approval by a majority of the registered voters of the Parish of Plaquemines, State of Louisiana voting on this proposition?
